text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Certificate of qualification" means a certificate of qualification issued by the Commissioner to act as a managing general agent.

section.section:
"Managing general agent" means a person:
that:
manages all or part of the insurance business of an insurer, including the management of a separate division, department, office, or subsidiary of the insurer; and
with or without authority, separately or with affiliates, directly or indirectly produces or underwrites gross direct written premiums at least equal to 5% of the insurer's policyholder surplus for any quarter or year, as reported in the insurer's most recently filed quarterly report or annual statement; and
that:
negotiates or binds ceding reinsurance contracts for the insurer;
adjusts or pays claims of more than $500; or
maintains loss reserves from which claims may be paid.

text.section: "Underwrite" means to accept or reject risks for an insurer.
